runs.comm: careful defence isn't exactly what Kusal Perera is known for, he steps down the track and pulls this away into the stands for six, that's more what Kusal is known for
slaps this one to point, can't beat the fielder
clips this in front of square leg for a single
driven towards mid-on to end the over
short ball is helped along behind square leg for four, doesn't try to power this one, just makes sure he gets enough bat on it
back of a length ball just outside off, flat-batted towards wide mid-on
outside off, powers that over cover for four more, up and over the infield and he's now 15 off 8
short of length ball angling away, stays a touch low, Perera looking to hammer it down the ground, doesn't connect
full ball on the pads, punched back to the bowler, Mashrafe does well to get down and stop that
short of length ball on off stump, pushed firmly towards cover
short of length ball angling in towards the stumps, worked towards square leg for a single, Dilshan is off the mark
short of length ball on leg stump, tucked towards midwicket
short of length and angling away outside off, Perera loves the width, that is crashed through covers for four, Sri Lanka are in a hurry here
full ball just outside off, Perera wants to clobber this down the ground, results in a bump ball towards the bowler
thumps this towards deep backward square leg for two more
good ball to end the over, short rising delivery, that Perera wanted to hook but he can't connect, was that too high, the umpire doesn't think so, it was a close call
thick outside edge on the first ball from Shakib, to short third man for a single
length ball just outside off, defended towards mid-on
defended towards mid-on by Perera

looks for the reverse-sweep, he misses and is struck on the pads, huge appeal for lbw, the umpire raises the finger, was that going on to hit leg stump? the replays show it was going to hit leg, Perera's cameo is over, Shakib strikes in his first over
full and just outside off, worked towards deep square leg for a single
backs away and punches that length ball on off stump towards extra cover

and Bangladesh have another one, Dilshan is bowled by Sunny, Dilshan backed away from the stumps just a little, he was looking to cut though the ball was on the stumps, he had to get bat on it, the ball stays a touch low so he can't, and that crashes into the stumps
this length ball is tucked towards midwicket, the crowd has found its voice again in Chittagong
Sangakkara gets going by working the ball towards midwicket
short of length ball spinning away, pushed towards point off the back foot
sliding towards middle and off, defended off the front foot
looks to chop that past point, a thick top edge sends the ball bouncing towards short third man
goes back in the crease and drives this towards cover
Chandimal drives this towards mid-on for a single
pushes this to the left of the bowler to get another easy single
sliding in towards leg stump, clipped towards deep square leg
full ball, eased towards long-on for one more, Sangakkara bringing some calmness to what has been a frenetic match, even by T20 standards
length ball just outside off, driven towards cover
wide outside off, chopped to backward point, smart stop there by the fielder
ooh, Sangakkara didn't know much about that one, that drifts in and turns away sharply, big turn takes the ball past the outside edge
guided towards point for a single
flighted length ball is pushed back towards the bowler

another reverse-sweep attempted, another lbw, Bangladesh are roaring back in this game, this was certainly going on to hit the stumps, the middle stump most likely, Sri Lanka are three down, the crowd is at its most vocal, an interesting hour ahead
drops it short, well outside off, chopped towards deep point for a single
eased towards mid-on for another easy single
one more, sensibly driven towards long-on, the asking rate is well in hand, so Sri Lanka's batsmen don't need to do anything spectacular
pushed back towards the bowler
short of length ball heading for off stump, eased towards long-on for a single
lofts this over short extra cover, a risky stroke but it evades the fielder and runs away towards long-off
flighted and well outside off, too wide says the umpire
spinning in towards the pads, pushed towards wide mid-on
turning away outside, slapped towards deep point
length ball is defended towards mid-on
driven to short extra cover, another dot ball
on the pads, eased in front of square leg for one more

Sangakkara wanted one after driving the ball towards short extra cover, the non-striker didn't, the fielder hadn't collected it cleanly, so Sanga can get back, Sangakkara points out to Angelo Perera that it was his call
and another one, what was Perera trying there? short of length ball that he wanted to slog away, he misses and that takes the off bail, which team's batsmen have been worse at shot selection today?
short of length ball is clipped behind square leg for a single
short of length ball is driven along the ground towards long-off for a single
worked towards midwicket for one more
Sangakkara is playing a superb hand here, showing the others how to play, no risk at all as he eases a length ball to long-off for one more

Sri Lanka are five down, Mathews is gone as he looks to guide the ball down towards third man, a thin edge through to the keeper, Mashrafe is ecstatic, he screams in joy as he sets off on a celebratory sprint
Sangakkara sticks to taking singles down the ground, one more to the right of the bowler
on the pads,tucked to square leg for a quick single
chops this towards sweeper cover for a single, that wasn't too far from off
length ball is driven towards long-on for one more, Sri Lanka's fifty is up
round the wicket from Mahmudullah, Sanga squared up a bit by the turn there as he defends
length ball is pushed back towards the bowler

Sri Lanka imploding in spectacular fashion here, Kulasekara drives this firmly towards mid-off, straight at the fielder, there was no time for the single, Sanga knew that and sends Kulasekara back, the fielder picks up cleanly and throws to the keeper, who has enough time to take off the bails before Kulasekara can make it back, he was out by a long way
short of length ball and angling away, Thisara Perera can't get bat on it, the crowd roars for every dot ball
pitched up and crisply driven but a diving stop by Sunny at cover
short of length ball, Sangakkara skips down the track and launches this straight over the bowler's head, all the way for six, bounces just a few yards in front of the sightscreen
pitched up and on the pads, clipped towards deep square leg
short of length ball is slugged away to the midwicket boundary, Thisara Perera has shown many a time how strong he is hitting in the arc between long-on and midwicket
short ball stays low, spins away outside off, mistimed towards mid-on
length ball on off stump,s clipped in front of square leg, sprints back for the second
drops it a touch short, stays low again, driven towards mid-on off the backfoot
driven towards mid-off by Sangakkara
goes well back in the crease, pushed towards mid-on for a single
full ball is clipped towards deep midwicket, doesn't power that one so there's time to get two
full ball outside off, driven firmly towards extra cover
angling away outside off, this one seamed away, Sangakkara looking to drive towards long-off as he has so often this innings, he's beaten by the movement
clipped towards midwicket for a single
short of length and outside off, room to free his arms, Perera has plenty of power, he flamboyantly slashes that over backward point
yorker just outside off, squeezed out towards point for a single
on the pads, helped towards deep backward square leg for two more to end the over
from round the wicket, the ball is pushed back towards the bowler
full and just outside off, blocked to the right of the bowler
nearly squeezed through the bat and pad, this drifts in and spins, just gets the inside edge, bounces through to the keeper, three dot balls
Nasir either bowls it wide outside off because the dew made it tough to grip, or because he expected a big swipe from Perera, it is a wide
played with soft hands towards long-on, Sanga sprints back for the second
full ball on the pads, firmly driven to long-on this time
short of length ball is pushed towards long-off for a single
short of length ball is eased to the right of Reza for a single
flat-batted towards long-on, Mahmudullah keeps it down to a single
short of length ball is driven towards mid-off, a diving Mashrafe Mortaza does the fielding
full and well outside off, crunched towards extra cover, Sanga sets off, Thisara doesn't, there;s a direct hit but Sanga is back in time
this has been a superb over so far from Reza, a wide yorker, Perera can't get under that one, drilled towards extra cover
driven towards long-on for a single, when do Sri Lanka decide it is time for one of the batsmen to go berserk? end of a top over from Reza
a high full toss to start the over, definitely a height no-ball, Sanga puts it away to the midwicket boundary
pitched up and on off stump, defended towards backward point for a single
a yorker on the pads, he manages to defend it towards cover
full ball is punched back past the non-striker's stumps, a good sliding stop by Sabbir at long-off, time enough to get a couple
game-changer this, Sangakkara has perished! he just guides this outside off delivery towards short third man, good low catch there, the crowd loves it, Bangladesh favourites now?
appeal for lbw, the ball rolls to the leg side, a leg bye is taken
length ball on middle, tucked towards deep square leg for a single
full ball from Mashrafe, drilled past the bowler for a single
angling in towards the pads, Senanayake gets SL to hundred with a single towards square leg
low full ball is thrashed to extra cover for one more
short of length ball is driven towards deep point for a single
full and wide, drilled to extra cover for a single, fifth in a row this over
short of length ball, a slower one is defended towards point, a dot ball to round off another excellent over from Bangladesh
good start from Rubel, gets the yorker in, pushed towards mid-off for a single
short, slower one outside off, slams this towards long-on for a single
high-risk stroke from Thisara, in keeping with the batting choices made in this game, a length ball just outside off, Thisara moves across the stumps and deftly guides this towards fine leg for four
full and wide, the yorker is crunched towards extra cover, where a misfield from Shakib doesn't just make the first run a comfortable one, it concedes a second

Thisara looks to repeat the shot that fetched him a boundary earlier this over, this was a lot fuller from Rubel, Thisara misses it, and somehow the ball misses the off stump as well, Rubel can't believe it
thumped to long-off for a single, so Sri Lanka need nine off the final over
full ball just outside off, Thisara again moves across the stumps, works this towards midwicket for a single
length ball is driven past a diving extra cover, they race through for two, a dive from Senanayake to make sure he is in

pitched up, driven towards wide long-on, superb stroke from Senanayake, this was a yorker, not easy to get that away anywhere, two more for Senanayake, well bowled by Reza but can't stop that from going for two
a single as Senanayake thumps the ball to long-on
slams this towards deep midwicket, just a single, Perera off the strike, SL need two, a single means a Super Over

yet again Senanayake is the man for the last ball, he does the job for Sri Lanka with a boundary behind square leg, wasn't the best of deliveries, short of length and sat up for Senanayake, who put it away, once again Sri Lanka snatch it on the final ball, Bangladesh are heartbroken once again, twice in three days they have pushed Sri Lanka all the way only to come up short
